Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2009 05:25AM respin wrote: Kacha, I did this test over the summer for gyno (not my oncologist) - my reading was 0 - no circulating tumor cells floating around. At the same time, (from my onc) I learned my marker was increasing and subsequent scan showed progression - within two weeks or so I was kicked off my meds.   Therefore the test, for me, wasn't reliable (my onc doesn't  do this test and didn't even want to know the results.)  Hope this helps.

Posts.Title: I'm still stable! ElaineD MJLToday

Posts.Content: respin wrote: I haven't been at this all that long....but wanted to offer some encouragement... On Xeloda/Tykerb since Aug. 31, and after a few weeks of dosage playing, my markers have dropped-scans mid-November..  (I'm still off Xeloda for a few more days until my feet blisters heal.) I did get a full body rash from the Tykerb...doc gave me a week break, I seem to be tolerating it much better.  GI problems aren't too bad, I take immodium every few days.  So while I've had side effects, they aren't diabilitating. Just putting this out there for anyone who is struggling - and anyone looking for feedback on this drug combo. Keep on keepin' on Dx 1/2009, IBC, 4cm, Stage IV, 2/2 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Encouragement Offered respin heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2009 05:41PM respin wrote: I wrote this in response to the "Defeated" thread...and in memory of Heidi, who always signed off with a "Best, Heidi" or a similar word of understanding/hope/acknowledgement. Re: the rash....My onc also said breaking out is good, and that it usually means the drug is working...however, she took me off for a week because of the facial rash (Clindomycin cleared it up within three days)  and the foot burning.  Since I've restarted I haven't had any reaction.  Go figure-I still expect it to be working.  She then took me off the Xeloda for a week because I had pretty big foot blisters....I'm to restart on Monday, at 3000 mg instead of 4000. Robin, I'd like to ask you some info re: the estrogen therapy you were (are) on - and how it might jumpstart (restart?) the Femara.  I'll PM when I can get some thoughts together....running off to do some hw (taking a Sat. morning class, and yes when I started I had worse acne than any of the 20 something year olds!)I told my onc. she was killing me! And... November is THE month for some serious cancer ass kicking!  (and end of October, for those coming up on scans sooner.) I find myself morbidly awaiting my scans -  Like give me the damn crystal light already....

Posts.Content: May 8, 2010 03:12PM respin wrote: Hi Bonnie, First, take a deep breath.  I have liver mets - and my doc once told me that a liver can function normally even if it's pretty compromised. She also told me she only glances at the liver tests if the numbers skyrocket, since everyday meds can bump up your numbers. How high was your total bilirubin number?  I admit I'm relatively knew at this (dx less than two years ago) - but I have never heard of A & C given for mets - especially since you are ER+.  Did the doc have a reason why he started you on this and instead of continuing you on another hormonal?  (I am guessing you had progression on Femara.)  I'm having a very good response to Aromasin (even though Femara quit on me in six months or so.)  Hang in there.

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2010 07:44PM respin wrote: I have/had this rash - ranging from facial acne (Clindamycin clears it in a few days) to 'pin prick' looking dots on my hands, to hive-sized rash along my legs, up my arms, and along my trunk. (Along with an itchy head and feet.) Dr. gave me some time off and cut my xeloda dosage back.  The only side effects that continued were the facial acne (yay!) and the red dots on my hands - but they come and go, and don't itch. Creams only help the peeling/dryness, not the rash itself. I think if you are new to xeloda/tykerb your ses will fade somewhat, but will probably flair up now and again.

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2010 04:46PM respin wrote: Nice to meet you, Karen, but sorry it's under these circumstances.   I am on Gemzar (which I think is similar to Navelbine) now - but have taken Xeloda (coupled with Tykerb) in the past.  Hair only thinned.  I have very sensitive skin, so I ended up with rashes, blisters on my feet, hives, split nails (need lots of lotion!)  I'm not sure Tykerb wasn't playing a part also, but even the Gemzar now seems to be giving me a rash (in addition to inflammation of my original tumor site.)   I also get (got) nauseous, but Zofran seems to keep that under control.   Good luck - here's hoping N/X is nothing but successful!

Best wishes.

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2009 11:34AM respin wrote: Hi Virginiamom, I also was diagnosed in January...with lung/liver mets. I think I'm still shell-shocked, and probably in some kind of denial.  I went back to work, and found that it helps me forget about the bc.  Of course nothing at work seems all that important to me either, so I find myself laughing at all the drama there. So, for me, that's a good thing. I am ER/PR + therefore I have different meds than you...doing hormonal therapy instead of chemo, so I can't comment on what kind of side effects you will have.  What I can offer you is good wishes on your trip.  How old is your daughter?  If she understands what you are going through, perhaps adjust the trip for an easier itinerary?   I hope you find the strength and are in good enough health to make the trip.

My rads oncologist originally wanted six weeks rads, but I can only give them 2 - I need to get back on treatment.

Posts.Content: respin wrote: Although I'm new and only pop in occasionally, I thought I'd share some good Femara/Herceptin news: My scan showed everything shrinking...my dr/nurse were very happy.  I know just stable is good, and I'm thankful, but somewhere deep down I was expecting to hear "all clear!" I've had minimal side effects, tolerate these meds pretty well.  My markers went from 106 to 46 to 36 and I *still* don't even really know what that means...does anyone understand these readings, if they aren't quantitative? Keep on keepin' on Dx 1/2009, IBC, 4cm, Stage IV, 2/2 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 1st Post Treatment Scan Results respin bmdaley
